# characters

**Instance Property**

The text storage contents as an array of characters.

## Declaration

```swift
var characters: [NSTextStorage] { get set }
```

## Discussion

Unless you’re dealing with scriptability, you shouldn’t use or modify this property directly. For indexed access to characters, use `NSAttributedString`’s [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Foundation/NSAttributedString/length] method to access the string, and `NSString`’s [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Foundation/NSString/character(at:)] method to access the individual characters.

## Accessing scriptable properties

- **attributeRuns**: The text storage contents as an array of attribute runs.
- **paragraphs**: The text storage contents as an array of paragraphs.
- **words**: The text storage contents as an array of words.
- **font**: The font for the text storage.
- **foregroundColor**: The color for the text.
